description:
Dietician

Full-time

Description

This opening is for a full-time position with the South Dakota Department of Health for a Registered Dietitian/Licensed Nutritionist (RD/LN) in the Office of Family Nutrition Services (OFNS). This role supports the Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) Supplemental Food Program in the west region of the state. The RD/LN will work under the supervision of the Dietitian Manager to deliver vital nutrition services that directly impact family and community health. This position will provide participant case management, approve special formula requests, consult with healthcare providers, and conduct quality assurance reviews for high-risk nutrition cases. Travel for meetings and on-site visits to maintain caseloads will be required.

 

Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women Infants and Children (WIC) 

Perform these duties approximately 65-75 percent of the time.

Additional functions of the position include, but are not limited to:

- Determine participant eligibility, including identity, income, residency, categorical and nutritional risk

- Provide nutrition support and education,

- Conduct nutrition education and health assessments

- Provide breastfeeding education and support, 

- Link clients to appropriate health and social resources,

- Offer nutrition related technical assistance to team members,

- Deliver nutrition education in community settings,

- Collaborate on setting nutrition, outreach, and breastfeeding goals for the population served

- Provide maternal and child health services, including developmental screenings, infant safe sleep education, and promotion of immunizations, oral health, and other public health initiatives

- Build and maintain collaborative relationships with community partners and providers to enhance referrals and explore innovative partnership opportunities

 

Must be licensed as a Nutritionist in South Dakota or eligible for licensure within one year of employment.

Master's degree required in human nutrition, public health nutrition, clinical nutrition, nutrition education, community education or foods and nutrition.

 

Dietetic internship or similar Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics approval required

 

Must be a Registered Dietitian with the Commision on Dietetic Registration (CDR) or obtain registration with 365 days of hire

 

Knowledge of:

-Motivational interviewing skills

-Principles and practices of food and nutrition sciences,

-Breastfeeding education

-Infant/child developmental milestones

 

Skills/Abilities to:

-Motivate participants to make decisions/goals to improve their nutritional status.

- Provide nutrition and health information effectively one-to-one and in group settings; virtual settings (zoom, teams, telemedicine); phone and text; and/or online.

- Share education at the client's level of understanding.

- Prioritize and facilitate referrals within the context of multiple and complicated participant needs.

- Apply federal and state regulations, policies and procedures in the functions of the position.

- Work both autonomously and in a team environment.

- Communicate effectively.

Demonstrate cultural competency when working with socioeconomically and culturally diverse populations.

- Recognize and facilitate opportunities for outreach, marketing, and partnership building.

- Communicate effectively with interpreters either in-person, by phone, or during virtual service delivery.

- Multitask, prioritize complex situations and adapt to quickly shifting priorities.


Benefits Include:

Bi-Weekly Pay

11 Paid Holidays Paid Vacation

Paid Sick Time

Mileage Reimbursement

description:
Are you a talented CAD Designer with a passion for precision and expertise in cooling tower systems? We're looking for a skilled professional to join our dynamic team and help bring cutting-edge projects to life.

Position Overview
As a CAD Designer specializing in cooling tower design, you will play a crucial role in creating detailed 2D and 3D models, ensuring projects are completed efficiently and to the highest standards. Your expertise will contribute to designing innovative solutions for industrial and commercial applications.
Key Responsibilities
  • Develop detailed CAD drawings for cooling tower components and systems.
  • Collaborate with engineers and project managers to ensure design accuracy and alignment with project specifications.
  • Conduct revisions and updates to existing designs based on feedback and project needs.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices.
  • Provide technical support and expertise throughout the project lifecycle.
Qualifications
  • Proven experience in CAD design, with a focus on cooling towers or related systems.
  • Proficiency in software such as AutoCAD, SolidWorks, or similar design tools.
  • Strong understanding of cooling tower mechanics and structural requirements.
  • Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Why Join Us?
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package.
  • Opportunity to work on innovative and impactful projects.
  • A supportive and collaborative work environment.
  • Career growth and development opportunities.

SALARY - 275K -330K

Various Locations in Cabarrus County (I.e. Concord - Kannapolis)

Start as Soon as possible
Full time

display_name: Public Health Assistant - Sioux Falls SD
description:
Public Health Assistant/WIC Program (Spanish Bilingual Preferred)

 

Description

Implement program policies and protocols and set the tone for excellent customer service to participants in the WIC offices. WPHA’s will complete certifications for low-risk participants, determining income, identity, and residency eligibility, completing nutrition assessments, providing basic nutrition education and completing food package assignments and referring participants to other social services and community resources, documenting accordingly, participating in breastfeeding promotion and support, issuing food benefits and serving as the liaison to WIC food vendors. In consultation and collaboration with health professionals, duties will include interviewing of participants for basic medical/social/nutritional history, obtaining anthropometric and biochemical measurements, and assessing immunization status of participants.

 

DUTIES:

  • Provides nutrition and health assessments, education, and support.
  • Promotes normal growth and maintenance of health.
  • Provides breastfeeding education and support.
  • Consultation with WIC dietitians to ensure special dietary needs of participants are met.
  • Work as a team in collaboration with other staff within the clinic to assure exceptional service provision.
  • In coordination with the team will help identify resource needs and prepare/submit purchasing requests that may include, but is not limited to, eWIC cards, breast pumps and formula.
  • In coordination with the team will help maintain inventory including computers and other equipment, eWIC cards, breast pumps and formula.
  • Works collaboratively with their local agency to develop Strategic Community Outreach & Outcomes Plan (SCOOP) focusing on nutrition, outreach, and breastfeeding goals for the population served.
  • Promote immunizations, oral health, and other public health services.
  • Collaborates with community partners and providers to build effective working relationships, enhance referral pathways, and explore opportunities to partner in new and innovative ways.
  • Explain the purpose of WIC to participants (what to expect at appointment).
  • Document all interaction with applicants/ participants.
  • Accurately obtain, determine and document proof of residence, proof of identity and proof of income.
  • Assess eligibility for SNAP, Medicaid and TANF to determine adjunct eligibility for WIC services and refer potentially eligible participants to such services.
  • Consistently use proper procedures to collect accurate biochemical and anthropometric measurements and medical and dietary assessment data.
  • Provide basic nutrition education, including breastfeeding promotion and support, which is responsive to the identified needs/interests of the participant.
  • Assist with benefit issuance that may include direct issuance of formula.· In coordination with the team, may print and distribute Notice of Ineligibility (mail, text, email, in-person)
  • Print and review Clients Eligible for Benefits reports monthly. Issue benefits as needed and attempt to contact client to schedule next appointment.
  • Print, provide and handle reports and statistical information as requested (dual participation, high-risk, show rates, etc.)
  • Print reports and contact participants to schedule appointments (follow-up contact, short certification report, clients scheduled outside 10/20 day limit)
  • Coordinate with the Team to review and respond to over issuance reports.
  • May act as a Vendor Liaison; provide general, local oversight and serve as point of contact for WIC retailers, investigate to resolve participants/vendor complaints or shopping issues, documenting outcome, and report ongoing/serious retailer issues to Central Office Vendor Team for follow-up.Meet requirements for pregnant women who have missed appointments to identify barriers and help overcome for access to WIC Program.
  • Breastfeeding complications refer to DBE, CLC or IBCLC.
  • Maintain the caseload that is assigned.
  • Notify the Registered Dietitian when a high-risk participant appointment (certification, recertification, or PCERT) was completed. Registered Dietitian will then review.
  • Assist the Central Office Program Integrity Specialist with program integrity as requested.
  • May provide WIC services utilizing the Wellness on Wheels (WOW) van.
  • Participate in conferences, WIC meetings, and in-services.
  • May participate in outreach activities and participant special events.
  • Provides finger testing for blood readings
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Possession of a valid driver’s license
  • Reliable transportation (travel is required)
  • High school diploma
  • Literacy and language skills appropriate to address the needs of diverse populations
  • Post-secondary education in a health-related field is desirable
  • Bilingual (Spanish) is a plus

 

 

Benefits Include:

Bi-Weekly Pay

11 Paid Holidays

Paid Vacation

Paid Sick Time

Mileage Reimbursement


 

Career Match is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description:
Position Summary:
We are seeking a professional Medical Spanish Interpreter to provide high‑quality interpretation and translation services for individuals seeking assistance from our organization. Under minimal supervision, this role assists the public in completing required paperwork and forms and coordinates related services as needed. The ideal candidate will be fluent in both Spanish and English and passionate about helping others navigate systems and access resources.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide on‑the‑spot interpretation in person and over the phone between Spanish and English for clients and staff.

  • Translate written materials such as forms, brochures, educational content, and instructions.

  • Assist clients with completing forms and required paperwork.

  • Schedule appointments, answer questions, and help coordinate additional services or referrals.

  • Gather and maintain information, data, or other materials needed to assist clients.

  • Perform various administrative support tasks to ensure smooth department operations.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Education: Associate’s degree in a related field (or an equivalent combination of education and experience).

  • Experience: Minimum of two years of related experience.

  • Fluency in both Spanish and English with strong interpreting skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field.

  • Medical interpreting certification is highly desirable.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Strong knowledge of interpreting and translation ethics and standards.

  • Excellent Spanish and English grammar, composition, and pronunciation.

  • Effective customer service and communication skills—both verbal and written.

  • Active listening, time management, and organizational skills.

  • Ability to multitask and manage sensitive client information confidentially.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other computer applications.

Physical Demands:

  • Ability to remain stationary for extended periods while performing duties.

  • Regular communication and interaction with clients and staff.

  • Occasional movement within the office and carrying/moving materials up to 20 lbs.

Work Environment:

  • Office setting with moderate noise levels.

description:
Job Description Summary:
A Forklift Operator is responsible for operating a forklift to move, locate, relocate, stack, and count merchandise and materials. The ideal candidate will safely and efficiently handle goods within the warehouse or distribution center while ensuring the integrity of all products. Forklift operators must follow all safety procedures and meet operational targets.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Operate a forklift to transport materials within the warehouse or distribution area

  • Load and unload materials from raw material inventory, roll stock, and work in progress (WIP)

  • Move materials to appropriate production locations

  • Stack materials or products in designated areas according to established procedures

  • Ensure the proper handling and safe transport of materials to prevent damage

  • Perform daily forklift inspections using the Forklift Inspection Report

  • Report any issues or malfunctions to the supervisor immediately

  • Maintain accurate inventory records

  • Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies

  • Assist in preparing goods for shipment and help with shipping/receiving when needed

  • Maintain a clean and organized work area

  • Assist in other areas of the manufacturing plant as needed

  • Complete any other tasks assigned by the Production/Process Manager

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent

  • Valid forklift certification required (or will be provided by the company)

  • Previous forklift or material handling experience preferred

  • Knowledge of safety protocols and procedures

  • Ability to read and interpret inventory systems and labels

  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment

  • Ability to stand, bend, twist, and lift up to 50 lbs for extended periods

  • Comfortable operating heavy machinery for extended periods

  • Ability to work in a warehouse/manufacturing environment with exposure to hazardous substances

Kirt Eure 
Career Match Solutions

description:
Animal Care Assistant

Job Overview

The Animal Care Assistant is responsible for tasks related to the health, care, and sustenance of animals, which may include dogs and cats in kennels.

Duties and Responsibilities

Note: The following duties are illustrative and not exhaustive. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment to the position.

Depending on the area of assignment, incumbents may perform tasks related to domestic dog and cat care, services, and kennel maintenance at a county animal shelter. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

  • Inventory Management: Maintain inventories of food, cleaning materials, and equipment.
  • Animal Care: Provide food and water to animals.
  • Sanitation: Clean animal kennels, cages, and shelter areas to ensure a sanitary and disease-free environment.
  • Equipment Operation: Operate pressure cleaning equipment, laundry washers and dryers, and dishwashing machines.
  • Additional Duties: Perform related work as required.

Job Specifications

  • Knowledge: General maintenance and sanitation techniques.
  • Direction Following: Ability to follow written and oral directions.
  • Independence: Ability to perform duties with little or no supervision.
  • Stress Management: Ability to work under stressful conditions.
  • Teamwork: Ability to work effectively with others.

Physical Requirements

  • Outdoor Work: Work is generally performed outdoors and may occur during adverse weather conditions.
  • Physical Activity: Involves activities requiring considerable use of arms and legs, such as climbing, lifting, walking, stooping, and handling materials, equipment, and supplies.
  • Animal Handling: Handle, position, and restrain live animals.

Work Category

Heavy Work: Exerting up to 100 pounds of force occasionally, up to 50 pounds of force frequently, and up to 20 pounds of force constantly to move objects.

Qualifications

Experience working with Animals

description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a reliable and customer-focused Customer Service Operator to join our team. This role is essential in ensuring safe, efficient, and courteous interactions with the public while maintaining the integrity of landfill operations. The ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment that combines indoor clerical work with outdoor operational duties.

Key Responsibilities

  • Respond to Inquiries: Provide information via phone, email, or in person regarding disposal policies, billing, collection schedules, and solid waste services.
  • Customer Assistance: Direct residents and businesses to appropriate disposal areas and assist with waste segregation protocols.
  • Gatekeeping & Load Screening: Monitor facility entry points, weigh vehicles, inspect loads for prohibited items, and enforce safety and disposal regulations.
  • Payment Processing & Record Keeping: Process payments accurately, balance cash drawers, and maintain daily operational records and logs.
  • Problem Resolution: Handle complaints or concerns professionally; coordinate with dispatchers, drivers, and other departments to resolve issues.
  • Clerical Duties: Perform administrative tasks such as data entry, filing, and utilizing CRM software and office systems.

Qualifications & Skills

  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written)
  • Proven customer service experience, with professionalism in stressful situations
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy in transactions and documentation
  • Basic math skills and comfort handling cash or credit transactions
  • Familiarity with CRM software, Microsoft Office, or similar systems
  • Problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or with a team
  • Knowledge of local solid waste regulations is a plus
  • Ability to work in variable weather conditions and interact respectfully with the public

Work Environment

This position involves both indoor office work and outdoor duties at the landfill or transfer station gate. Candidates should be comfortable with:

  • Standing or sitting for extended periods
  • Exposure to outdoor elements and heavy equipment noise
  • Occasional interactions with upset or frustrated individuals

description:
Job Description Summary:
The Assembly Material Handler is responsible for ensuring a steady and accurate flow of materials and components required for production. This includes transporting materials by forklift, pallet jack, hand truck, or manual lifting. The role also involves maintaining accurate sheet inventory, supporting production orders, and adhering to safety procedures. A clean and organized workspace is expected.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Supply assembly lines with raw materials, parts, and components to maintain consistent production flow

  • Load, unload, and transport materials using forklifts, pallet jacks, hand trucks, or by hand

  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date inventory records

  • Organize and store materials in designated areas for accessibility

  • Stage materials for production to ensure correct items are ready for scheduled runs

  • Inspect incoming materials for quality; report any defects or damages

  • Dispose of scrap materials and follow all waste management procedures

  • Adhere to all workplace safety guidelines and proper material handling protocols

  • Work collaboratively with assembly supervisors and production staff to maintain workflow

  • Assist in other areas of the manufacturing plant as needed

  • Perform any other tasks assigned by the Assembly Supervisor or Inventory Manager

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent (manufacturing or warehouse experience preferred)

  • Experience in material handling, inventory control, or assembly environments

  • Ability to operate forklifts and other material-handling equipment (certification is a plus)

  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

  • Effective communication skills and a positive team-oriented attitude

  • Ability to stand, bend, twist, and lift up to 50 lbs for extended periods

  • Comfortable working in a warehouse environment with heavy machinery and possible exposure to hazardous materials

description:
Position Summary

We are seeking a skilled Set Up Technician to prepare, install, adjust, and maintain production equipment during tooling changeovers. In this hands-on role, you will set up machines, run test samples, troubleshoot issues, and work closely with production teams to maximize uptime and product quality.

Key Responsibilities

  • Tooling Changeovers – Set up and configure machines/equipment per production specs; manage complete product-to-product changeover until sign-off by the Production/Process Manager.

  • Test Runs & Adjustments – Conduct test runs, make fine-tuning adjustments, and verify proper operation before release to production.

  • Troubleshooting – Diagnose and resolve setup-related mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, or hydraulic issues quickly to minimize delays.

  • Preventive Maintenance – Perform routine PM, inspections, cleaning, and minor repairs on setup tools and associated equipment.

  • Blueprint & Tool Interpretation – Read/interpret blueprints, mold drawings, and tooling documentation to ensure accurate setups.

  • Mold & Tool Changes – Swap molds, dies, tooling, and auxiliary components for different production runs.

  • Continuous Improvement – Monitor machine performance, collaborate with operators, and suggest efficiency improvements.

  • Documentation – Record setup procedures, adjustments, and issues; communicate promptly with supervisors or maintenance.

  • Work-Area Management – Keep setup and maintenance areas clean, organized, and compliant with safety regulations.

  • Other Duties – Assist in other manufacturing areas and perform tasks assigned by the Production/Process Manager.

Qualifications

Must-Have Preferred
High-school diploma or GED Technical certificate or associate degree in manufacturing/industrial technology
2–3 years’ experience in industrial maintenance, manufacturing, or facility maintenance Prior plastics processing or high-volume changeover experience
Working knowledge of mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, hydraulic, and plumbing systems Familiarity with PLCs, low-voltage systems, HVAC, and automation
Proven troubleshooting and problem-solving ability Experience maintaining detailed PM or setup logs
Ability to lift ≤ 50 lbs, stand/bend/twist for extended periods, and operate heavy machinery safely Basic CAD/blueprint reading coursework

Soft Skills & Attributes

  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality

  • Clear communicator who collaborates well with cross-functional teams

  • Self-starter capable of working independently with minimal supervision

  • Safety-minded and disciplined in following SOPs and regulations

Work Environment

  • Warehouse/manufacturing setting with frequent exposure to moving machinery, noise, and occasional hazardous substances

  • Regular use of hand, power, pneumatic, and hydraulic tools

  • PPE provided and required per task

description:
About Us

We are a leading Staffing company specializing in the staffing of construction, and maintenance of cooling tower systems. Committed to innovation, sustainability, and excellence, we prioritize the safety and well-being of our employees and clients in every project we undertake

Job Summary

The Safety Manager is responsible for developing, implementing, and monitoring comprehensive safety programs to ensure a safe working environment for all employees. This role plays a critical part in maintaining regulatory compliance, minimizing risk, and fostering a culture of safety within the organization, particularly in the high-stakes field of cooling tower manufacturing, construction, and maintenance.

Key Responsibilities

  • Safety Program Management:

    • Develop, implement, and update safety policies and procedures.

    • Conduct regular risk assessments and site inspections.

    • Lead the implementation of safety management systems (e.g., OSHA, ISO).

  • Training and Development:

    • Organize and conduct safety training sessions and drills.

    • Train staff on hazard identification, risk mitigation, and emergency procedures.

    • Maintain training records and ensure all employees are up to date on certifications.

  • Regulatory Compliance:

    • Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal safety regulations (e.g., OSHA, EPA).

    • Prepare for and manage external audits and inspections.

    • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of safety laws and industry best practices.

  • Incident Management:

    • Investigate accidents, incidents, and near-misses to determine root causes.

    • Recommend corrective actions to prevent future occurrences.

    • Maintain incident reports and analyze trends to improve safety measures.

  • Collaboration and Communication:

    • Work closely with project managers, site supervisors, and employees to address safety concerns.

    • Communicate safety updates and improvements to all levels of the organization.

    • Act as a liaison with regulatory agencies and external safety consultants.

Qualifications

  • Education:

    • Bachelor’s degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, or a related field.

    • Certifications such as CSP (Certified Safety Professional) or OSHA 30-hour certification are highly desirable.

  • Experience:

    • Minimum 5 years of experience in a safety management role, preferably in construction, manufacturing, or industrial settings.

    • Experience in the cooling tower industry or related heavy industrial sectors is a plus.

  • Skills:

    • Strong knowledge of safety regulations and compliance standards.

    • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

    • Exceptional communication and leadership abilities.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.

  • Opportunities for professional development and growth.

  • A supportive work environment dedicated to innovation and safety.

How to Apply

Please send your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications and interest in this opportunity

description:
Receptionist

Full-time

Aberdeen, SD

Job Summary:

As a member of the Women, Infants and Children (WIC) Team, this position will assist with the provision of WIC services for individuals, families, and communities. The receptionist will set the tone for excellent customer service as the initial contact for the office whether in-person, by phone, or through digital correspondence. The receptionist will greet, direct, and respond to applicants, participants, and the public regarding requests or questions about routine program operations.

Provide support to case managers including gathering, organizing, and entering applicant and participant information, composing and finalizing correspondences, and reviewing documents and other materials for errors and completeness. Support overall office function by establishing and maintaining filling systems and databases and ensuring office publications remain current. Work as a team in collaboration with other staff within the office, local agency, and region to assure exceptional service provision. Will work under the direction of a Manager and Team Lead. Will be supervised by the Manager.

Functions:
• Greet and direct applicants, participants, and the public.
• Respond to requests or questions regarding routine program operations.
• Check in participants.
• Answer and route phone calls and messages.
• Retrieve office voice messages and route to appropriate person.
• Assist case managers with appointment reminders and cancellations.
• Ensure all required proofs are received prior to certification.
• Scan in medical and other documents and notify case manager.
• Send out mailings and faxes as requested.
• Compose and edit letters, help draft messages, and take meeting minutes as requested.
• Review routine forms, documents, or materials to check for errors and verify completeness.
• Review brochures and marketing materials ensuring they are the most current and copies are available.
• Establish and maintain filing systems, electronic and hard copy.
• Electronically file and retrieve a variety of materials to maintain records.
• Help maintain referral listings in coordination with team.
• Open and route incoming office mail. Sort and bundle outgoing mail.
• Monitor office email and forward to appropriate party.
• Make travel arrangements, i.e. carpool reservations, WOW van scheduling, hotel reservations
• Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
High School Diploma
Bilingual Preference (Spanish)
Possession of a valid driver’s license
Rev. 11-13-2024

Knowledge, Skills, & Ability:
Knowledge of: proficiency in English grammar, spelling, and punctuation, with the ability to apply them effectively in written communication; familiarity with modern office equipment, practices, and procedures; expertise in Microsoft Office Suite applications; and understanding of department rules, procedures, and functions.
Skills and abilities to: type accurately; collect, analyze, and summarize data from various sources; efficiently operate a range of office equipment; communicate information clearly and concisely in both verbal and written forms; review and comprehend program materials; establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues and the general public; and apply literacy and language skills to effectively serve diverse populations.

Must be able to work Monday through Friday between 8am and 5pm. Occasional hours outside of 8am – 5pm may be required to support services. Occasional travel may be required to provide services, attend trainings/meeting, and provide office coverage.

Department of Health Information:
The South Dakota Department of Health's programs and services help prevent illness and injury, promote healthy places to live, work and play; provide education to help people make good health decisions; prepare for, respond to, and prevent public health threats; and support efforts to enhance quality and accessibility of healthcare. Our services touch the lives of every person in South Dakota. We recognize that employees are our most valuable resource, and we are committed to promoting a culture of excellence in the Department of Health. We trust our employees to be innovative, challenge existing processes, and make the best decisions. We are interested in employing a culturally diverse and skilled workforce that exhibits the values of leadership, accountability, communication, integrity, and teamwork. Public health is a diverse and growing field that offers many career options for people from a variety of educational backgrounds. Imagine yourself as part of a winning team that is making the lives of South Dakotans healthier and safer.

Benefits Include:

Bi-Weekly Pay

11 Paid Holidays

Paid Vacation

Paid Sick Time

Mileage Reimbursement

description:
POSITION SUMMARY
Performs clerical and technical work of moderate difficulty, variety and specialization in a department.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Provides administrative support to the department and ensures that routine activities are completed in a timely manner.

  • Answer, screen, or forward calls, providing information, taking messages, or scheduling appointments.

  • Greets persons entering establishment, determines nature and purpose of visit, and directs or escorts them to specific destinations.

  • Transmits information or documents to customers, using computer, mail, or fax machine.

  • Files and maintains records.

  • Collects, sorts, distributes, or prepares mail, messages, or courier deliveries.

  • Creates, files, and maintains records.

  • Performs data entry.

  • Compiles reports.

  • Transcribes meeting minutes.

  • Creates basic correspondence conducting research and performing basic quantitative quality assurance reviews.

  • Reads and analyzes incoming memos, submissions, and reports to determine their significance and plan their distribution.

  • Prepares responses to correspondence containing routine inquiries.

  • Conducts research, compiles data, and prepares documents for consideration and presentation to managers, committees.

  • Performs general office duties, such as ordering supplies, maintaining records, and management database systems.

  • Researches files and systems for information to assist customers. 

  • Schedules appointments.

  • Files and retrieves information such as documents, records, and reports.

  • Gathers information from customers for eligibility of services based on established criteria.

  • Attends meetings to take minutes.

  • May maintain cash funds or petty cash funds.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience:  Two years of clerical experience.
Education:  High school diploma or equivalent.

Combination of relevant education and relevant experience accepted? Yes
Licenses and Certifications:  N/A. 

 


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of:

  • Business English, spelling and arithmetic.

  • Overall function and responsibilities and services in assigned area.

  • Administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, filing and other office procedures and terminology


Skilled in:

  • Proficient use of basic computer skills, i.e., Microsoft Office Suite


Abilities:

  • Initiating Action – Taking prompt action to accomplish objectives; take action to achieve goals beyond what is required; being proactive.

  • Stress tolerance – Maintaining stable performance under pressure or opposition; handling stress in a manner that is acceptable to others and to the organization.

  • Building Customer Loyalty – Effectively meeting customer needs; building productive customer relationships; taking responsibility for customer satisfaction and loyalty.

  • Managing Work – Effectively managing one’s time and resources to ensure that work is completed efficiently.

  • Building Trust – Interacting with others in a way that gives them confidence in one’s intentions and those of the organization.

description:
About the Role:
We are seeking a skilled Industrial Mechanic to join our team in Tampa, FL. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in maintaining and repairing water, wastewater, and reclaimed water treatment equipment. This position plays a vital role in ensuring the efficient and safe operation of critical treatment systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Inspect, maintain, troubleshoot, and repair treatment plant equipment, including:

    • Pumps (centrifugal, split case, submersible, positive displacement, diaphragm, vertical turbine)

    • Valves, piping, and gearboxes

    • Air systems, gas compressors, gas service turbine generators

    • Grit chambers and chemical systems (sodium hypochlorite, hydrofluorosilicic acid, aqueous ammonia, sodium aluminate, sodium hydroxide/caustic soda)

  • Perform predictive and preventative maintenance on all equipment.

  • Conduct pump and motor alignments, including laser alignment on blowers and motors.

  • Perform vibration and ultrasound testing on motors, gearboxes, pumps, and blowers using provided tools.

  • Apply advanced preventative maintenance practices, including lubrication and greasing procedures for all listed equipment.

  • Ensure safety standards and compliance with industry regulations.

Qualifications & Skills:

  • Proven experience as an Industrial Mechanic in water/wastewater or similar industrial settings.

  • Strong troubleshooting skills for pumps, motors, and other mechanical systems.

  • Proficiency in using vibration analysis, ultrasound testing, and laser alignment equipment.

  • In-depth knowledge of preventative maintenance techniques and best practices.

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

  • Strong commitment to safety and operational excellence.

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.

  • Comfortable working in outdoor/industrial environments and around hazardous chemicals (with proper PPE).

Benefits:

  • Competitive hourly wage based on experience

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Paid time off and holidays

  • Retirement plan options

  • Ongoing training and development opportunities

description:
Job Description: Customer Service Representative

Overview

We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Customer Service Representative to join our team. In this role, you will serve as the first point of contact for our clients, providing exceptional service and support. Your primary responsibilities will include addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring a positive experience for all clients. The ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills, a customer-centric mindset, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

  • Respond promptly to customer inquiries via phone, email, and chat.
  • Provide accurate information regarding products and services.
  • Analyze customer needs and offer appropriate solutions.
  • Assist with order processing and follow up on client requests.
  • Maintain detailed records of customer interactions in our database.
  • Collaborate with team members to improve service delivery.
  • Conduct outbound calling to follow up on leads or customer feedback.
  • Uphold company policies and procedures while ensuring client satisfaction.

Skills

  • Proficient in using computerized systems for data entry and record management.
  • Strong analytical skills to assess customer needs effectively.
  • Familiarity with Office applications for documentation and reporting.
  • Previous experience in client services or sales is a plus.
  • Excellent customer service skills with a focus on building relationships.
  • Demonstrated phone etiquette for professional communication.
  • Experience with outbound calling to engage clients or prospects.
  • Multilingual abilities are an advantage, particularly in English.

description:
We are seeking a skilled Bandsaw Operator to join our production team in Hardeeville, SC. The Bandsaw Operator is responsible for safely and efficiently operating bandsaw equipment to cut materials to specified dimensions, while maintaining high standards of quality, safety, and productivity.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Operate a bandsaw to cut materials (metal, plastic, or wood) to required specifications.

  • Review work orders, blueprints, and production schedules to determine cutting requirements.

  • Set up and adjust bandsaw equipment, including blade changes, guides, and tension settings.

  • Inspect materials before and after cutting to ensure accuracy and quality.

  • Perform daily inspections and routine maintenance of bandsaw equipment.

  • Report equipment malfunctions or safety concerns promptly.

  • Keep accurate production and material usage records.

  • Maintain a clean, safe, and organized work area.

  • Assist with moving materials to production or storage areas.

  • Support other areas of the plant as needed.

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.

  • Previous experience operating a bandsaw or similar cutting machinery preferred.

  • Manufacturing experience strongly preferred.

  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, work orders, and measurement tools.

  • Knowledge of machine operation procedures and safety protocols.

  • Strong attention to detail and quality.

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

  • Physical ability to stand, bend, twist, and lift up to 50 lbs for extended periods.

  • Comfortable working in a manufacturing environment with heavy machinery, noise, and potential exposure to hazardous materials.

Why Join Us:
At Career Match Solutions, we value safety, teamwork, and quality. We offer competitive pay, a supportive work environment, and opportunities to grow within our company.

description:
Public Health Assistant/WIC Program (Spanish Bilingual Preferred)

 

Description

Implement program policies and protocols and set the tone for excellent customer service to participants in the WIC offices. WPHA’s will complete certifications for low-risk participants, determining income, identity, and residency eligibility, completing nutrition assessments, providing basic nutrition education and completing food package assignments and referring participants to other social services and community resources, documenting accordingly, participating in breastfeeding promotion and support, issuing food benefits and serving as the liaison to WIC food vendors. In consultation and collaboration with health professionals, duties will include interviewing of participants for basic medical/social/nutritional history, obtaining anthropometric and biochemical measurements, and assessing immunization status of participants.

 

DUTIES:

  • Provides nutrition and health assessments, education, and support.
  • Promotes normal growth and maintenance of health.
  • Provides breastfeeding education and support.
  • Consultation with WIC dietitians to ensure special dietary needs of participants are met.
  • Work as a team in collaboration with other staff within the clinic to assure exceptional service provision.
  • In coordination with the team will help identify resource needs and prepare/submit purchasing requests that may include, but is not limited to, eWIC cards, breast pumps and formula.
  • In coordination with the team will help maintain inventory including computers and other equipment, eWIC cards, breast pumps and formula.
  • Works collaboratively with their local agency to develop Strategic Community Outreach & Outcomes Plan (SCOOP) focusing on nutrition, outreach, and breastfeeding goals for the population served.
  • Promote immunizations, oral health, and other public health services.
  • Collaborates with community partners and providers to build effective working relationships, enhance referral pathways, and explore opportunities to partner in new and innovative ways.
  • Explain the purpose of WIC to participants (what to expect at appointment).
  • Document all interaction with applicants/ participants.
  • Accurately obtain, determine and document proof of residence, proof of identity and proof of income.
  • Assess eligibility for SNAP, Medicaid and TANF to determine adjunct eligibility for WIC services and refer potentially eligible participants to such services.
  • Consistently use proper procedures to collect accurate biochemical and anthropometric measurements and medical and dietary assessment data.
  • Provide basic nutrition education, including breastfeeding promotion and support, which is responsive to the identified needs/interests of the participant.
  • Assist with benefit issuance that may include direct issuance of formula.· In coordination with the team, may print and distribute Notice of Ineligibility (mail, text, email, in-person)
  • Print and review Clients Eligible for Benefits reports monthly. Issue benefits as needed and attempt to contact client to schedule next appointment.
  • Print, provide and handle reports and statistical information as requested (dual participation, high-risk, show rates, etc.)
  • Print reports and contact participants to schedule appointments (follow-up contact, short certification report, clients scheduled outside 10/20 day limit)
  • Coordinate with the Team to review and respond to over issuance reports.
  • May act as a Vendor Liaison; provide general, local oversight and serve as point of contact for WIC retailers, investigate to resolve participants/vendor complaints or shopping issues, documenting outcome, and report ongoing/serious retailer issues to Central Office Vendor Team for follow-up.Meet requirements for pregnant women who have missed appointments to identify barriers and help overcome for access to WIC Program.
  • Breastfeeding complications refer to DBE, CLC or IBCLC.
  • Maintain the caseload that is assigned.
  • Notify the Registered Dietitian when a high-risk participant appointment (certification, recertification, or PCERT) was completed. Registered Dietitian will then review.
  • Assist the Central Office Program Integrity Specialist with program integrity as requested.
  • May provide WIC services utilizing the Wellness on Wheels (WOW) van.
  • Participate in conferences, WIC meetings, and in-services.
  • May participate in outreach activities and participant special events.
  • Provides finger testing for blood readings
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Possession of a valid driver’s license
  • Reliable transportation (travel is required)
  • High school diploma
  • Literacy and language skills appropriate to address the needs of diverse populations
  • Post-secondary education in a health-related field is desirable
  • Bilingual (Spanish) is a plus

 

 

Benefits Include:

Bi-Weekly Pay

11 Paid Holidays

Paid Vacation

Paid Sick Time

Mileage Reimbursement

description:
Job Description Summary:
The Thermoformer Operator is responsible for setting up, operating, and maintaining thermoforming machines and auxiliary equipment that shape plastic materials using heat, pressure, and molds. This role ensures smooth machine operation while adhering to safety protocols, maintaining product quality, and meeting production cycle times.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Set up and operate thermoforming machines based on work orders, production schedules, and safety guidelines

  • Monitor machine performance during production and adjust parameters to maintain efficiency and quality

  • Load raw plastic materials into the machines and set temperatures according to standard operating procedures (SOP)

  • Inspect finished products for defects to ensure they meet customer specifications and PPI quality standards

  • Troubleshoot and resolve machine malfunctions; perform minor repairs or adjustments as needed

  • Clean machines following PPI’s cleaning procedures and lockout/tagout protocols

  • Record production data including cycle times, material usage, downtime, and production inventory

  • Adhere to all safety regulations and ensure proper handling and disposal of materials and waste

  • Communicate effectively with team members and supervisors regarding production progress or issues

  • Assist in training and mentoring new or junior staff as needed

  • Support other departments or tasks as assigned by the Production/Process Manager

  • Provide support in other manufacturing areas as required

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required

  • Technical certification or manufacturing training preferred

  • Prior experience in thermoforming or a similar production environment preferred

  • Strong knowledge of thermoforming machines and auxiliary equipment

  • Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

  • Attention to detail and commitment to high product quality

  • Ability to meet production deadlines in a fast-paced setting

  • Strong communication and teamwork skills

  • Physically able to stand, bend, twist, and lift up to 50 lbs for extended periods

  • Comfortable operating heavy machinery for prolonged durations

  • Willingness to work in warehouse/manufacturing conditions, with exposure to noise, heat, and hazardous materials
